intro: Psychotria kisantuensis, commonly known as the Kisantu Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of Central Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows as an understory plant, thriving in the shaded environments of dense forest canopies. The species is of interest to botanists due to its potential ecological role and chemical composition.
